document.title: Deploying Projects Outside of Visual Studio .NET

toc.envision_title: Deploying Projects Outside of Visual Studio .NET

document.paragraph:
If you do not have access to Visual Studio .NET Enterprise Edition or better, or simply to not want to use the integrated ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmsetup and deployment projects, you can still deploy your EiffelEnvision projects with ease whether you are simply archiving the project for distribution, using ZIP, RAR or another popular format, or using tools such as InstallShield or Wise.
requirements2Deployment Requirements In order to deploy your EiffelEnvision project(s) without the aid of Visual Studio .NET, you will need to ensure your EiffelEnvision project(s) have been compiled successfully before continuing. Projects that have not been compiled may not have any project output generated or the project output may be out of date. deploying_projects2Deploying Projects Once you have a compiled one or more EiffelEnvision project(s) successfully, each of the projects will contain a bin folder located in the project folder. In the bin folder there will be one or more subfolders, depending on what ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskcreatingandeditingconfigurations.htmconfigurations you have built to date. There will be one folder for each ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconbuildsduringapplicationdevelopment.htmproject configuration. The configuration name may or may no be the same name as the selected ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconbuildsduringapplicationdevelopment.htmsolution configuration depending on how you configured your project and solutions configuration using the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskcreatingandeditingconfigurations.htmconfiguration manager.
To deploy a project, simply take the contents of the bin\configuration_name folder. Note: You should be aware that the bin folder will also contain any debugging information if the corresponding project configuration is set to ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/debugging.xmlgenerate_debug_informationGenerate Debug Information. Warning: EiffelEnvision will only copy assemblies and any supporting binaries to the bin\configuration_name folder in addition to the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/cpguide/html/cpconapplicationconfigurationfiles.htmapplication configuration file. If you want to distribute other resources, such as bitmaps, icons, cursors, etc. you will need to include these files manually in your preferred means of deployment. deploying_sources2Deploying Source Files If you require to deploy your project source files, you will simply need to include all of the files and subfolders located in the project folder, with the exception of the bin and obj folders. All paths stored in an EiffelEnvision project file are relative to the project location, making the project portable. EiffelEnvision also permits the use of ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/environment_variables.xmlEnvironment Variables in all paths making the project even more portable than projects created for other languages in Visual Studio .NET. also_see2Related SectionsSee Also:redistributions.xmlRedistributing the Eiffel Runtimeindex.xmlDeploying Projectsms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconDeployingSolution.htmDeploying Applications../compiling_projects/compiling_projects.xmlCompiling Projectsms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconProjectProperties.htmProject Properties../eiffelenvision_projects/structure/known_folders.xmlEiffelEnvision Known Folders../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/environment_variables.xmlUsing Environment Variables
